posts.post_content: Prefer good centering. SGC ok too. Open to other t206 Cobbs but strong preference for the green one.

I just won the T206 Cobb green PSA 4 in the Goldin auction and most likely will sell my existing copy, a PSA 3; it is in nice shape, great registration and color, slt o/c top/bottom with the only problem some slight paper loss not really affecting the Piedmont back.  If you have any interest, I will try to get you a scan (not my forte) and work up a price.  Cheers. John

[quote name="Yoda" post=1473253]I just won the T206 Cobb green PSA 4 in the Goldin auction and most likely will sell my existing copy, a PSA 3; it is in nice shape, great registration and color, slt o/c top/bottom with the only problem some slight paper loss not really affecting the Piedmont back.  If you have any interest, I will try to get you a scan (not my forte) and work up a price.  Cheers. John[/QUOTE]

man where you when I listed two centered psa 4 green cobbs on net54 this year...

[quote name="Yoda" post=1473253]I just won the T206 Cobb green PSA 4 in the Goldin auction and most likely will sell my existing copy, a PSA 3; it is in nice shape, great registration and color, slt o/c top/bottom with the only problem some slight paper loss not really affecting the Piedmont back.  If you have any interest, I will try to get you a scan (not my forte) and work up a price.  Cheers. John[/QUOTE]

Nice congrats.  I am interested in taking a look at it, but actually ended up buying the red Cobb in the goldin auction.  So I will probably have to put the green Cobb on hold for a while.  But if it looks good I might pick it up anyway.  Send the scan to [url]jesse.arnot@gmail.com[/url]

And Jake I think I had bought a couple Mantles when your green Cobbs were for sale but I wish I had picked one of them up.

couldn't go wrong either way..funny I ended up buying mantles  with the cobb money ..
